entry.def: A claimant is someone who is receiving money from the state because they are unemployed or they are unable to work because they are ill.
A claimant is someone who asks to be given something which they think they are entitled to.

Sentence.sentence: In 2005, the Authors Guild of America, together with a group of US publishers, launched a class action suit (集团诉讼) against Google that, after more than two years of negotiation, ended with an announcement last October that Google and the claimants had reached an out-of-court settlement.
